subject: Re: Looking for example of necessary tearDown( )
msgSnippet: ... Doesn t this qualify as a memory leak? Is this a known bug or working as designed? Mayby I didn t understand fully what you meant: when the TestRunner is
messageBody:
Thank you (and the others) for the answer. One question, though:

> Here's another example:
> The JUnit 3 test runners create all test cases before running, and
> keep references to them in memory after running. Anything kept as field
> references in a test class will not be GC'd until the test runner
> releases the test class reference (which is never).

Doesn't this qualify as a memory leak? Is this a known bug or working
as designed? Mayby I didn't understand fully what you meant: when the
TestRunner is done, isn't it GC'ed by itself?
